thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Comfort Accessory for Outdoor Enthusiasts (PIT-140)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Comfort Accessory for Outdoor Enthusiasts (PIT-140) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Comfort Accessory for Outdoor Enthusiasts (PIT-140)
text:
InventHelp is a large invention submission firm, and is submitting the GNAT AWAY to companies for their consideration.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 24, 2015
"A friend and I embarked on a four-day bike trip/adventure from Cumberland, Maryland, to Washington D.C., and, needless to say, we expected perils along the way that were more in the way of muscle fatigue, as well as weather and mechanical problems," said an inventor from Conneaut Lake, Pa. "Much to our surprise, one of the biggest challenges were bugs! Mostly gnats, but also bees, flies and other flying insects. Throughout the trip I found myself wishing I could breathe normally and talk to my friend without fear of swallowing what seemed like thousands of insects. And, thus, I invented GNAT AWAY."
She developed the GNAT AWAY to keep insects out of the mouth. The unit does not interfere with normal breathing. The device makes exercising outdoors more comfortable and enjoyable. It eliminates hassles and frustrations. The item is easy to use. Furthermore, the accessory is ideal for use when bicycling or jogging.
The original design was submitted to the Pittsburgh office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-PIT-140, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
